page.title: 18LOCAL RADIO IN NAIRN AREA
page.content: The Moray Firth area's local radio is catered for by{Moray Firth Radio} ,called{MFR}for short.MFR is based in Inverness,and went on air at 6.30 a.m. on the 23rd of February,1982.MFR is also one of the I.B.A.'s Independent Local Radio stations.A 1984 survey showed that 57% of the population listen to MFR at some point during any one week.These are the joint highest figures for the U.K.,along with Downtown Radio in Belfast.MFR has a back-up team of volunteers called Radio Action,with eight branches in the MFR area.Nairn has its own branch.At weekends,nearly all the programmes are done by Radio Action.MFR broadcasts on 271m/1107khz medium wave and in stereo on 95.9 mhz vhf
